title: Commentary Considerations for Recommending Extended Use and Limited Reuse of Filtering Facepiece Respirators in Health Care Settings
text:
OSHA develops and enforces workplace regulations on respiratory protection
 NIOSH certifies respirators and develops recommendations on the use of respiratory protection in health care workplaces to protect workers
 There is also a general lack of awareness among infection control professionals and safety/ employee health administrators in understanding FDA's role in regulating surgical N95 respirators
While OSHA is responsible for regulating employers to provide a safe workplace for their employees and CDC makes public health recommendations that are often adopted by hospitals, FDA has a different role in health care settings
